timeline.bodyText: Do we still depend on the AST models? We should depend on the Syntax Tree, since we have the particular APIs
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: Ack, will migrate this. Earlier tried but couldn't achieve due to limitations in semantic-api. now we should be able to migrate.
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText: May be we can omit the variable here, if we need more clarification, let's put a comment
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText:
Since the name FunctionCallExpressionNode is bit longer; it wraps the statement into multiple lines. Thus, introduced this local variable.
boolean isWithinFile = ((FunctionCallExpressionNode) cursorNode).functionName().kind() == SyntaxKind.SIMPLE_NAME_REFERENCE;
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText:
Are these checks valid? We are comparing two different hierarchies, semantic API against the AST.
Please revisit the if-else ladder
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: No, this has to revamped when we get type-info for literals. Kept it intact since for the reference of code-migration and it doesn't affect the other flow. Should we remove these checks?
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText: If commenting the code section is intentional, let's add a TODO as well
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: Yes, whole method getPossibleTypes need to revamp after literals type-info is avaialble
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText: let's use a meaningful variable name
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: i think we have one letter names for lambdas in many places. otherwise it will be lengthy and need to wrap for multiple lines. wdyt?
replies.author: rasika

timeline.bodyText: Let's add a doc comment for the public APIs
timeline.author: nadeeshaan
